intro: Ceropegia baldratii subsp. somalensis, commonly known as the Somali milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in racemes. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
